semantic_title: Postoperative Pain Not Associated with Specific Postoperative Complication
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 6. Chapter 6: Diseases of the Nervous System > b. Pain - Category G89 > 3) Postoperative Pain > (a) Postoperative pain not associated with specific postoperative complication

content.full_text: Postoperative pain not associated with a specific postoperative complication is assigned to the appropriate postoperative pain code in category G89. (Evidence: pg no: 47, L52-L53)
content.summary: Guidelines for coding postoperative pain when it is not related to a specific postoperative complication, using G89 category codes. (Evidence: pg no: 47, L52-L53)
key_concepts: Non-complication postoperative pain (Evidence: pg no: 47, L52)
G89 category assignment (Evidence: pg no: 47, L53)
Specific complication distinction (Evidence: pg no: 47, L52)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Postoperative pain not associated with a specific postoperative complication is assigned to the appropriate postoperative pain code in category G89 (Evidence: pg no: 47, L52-L53)
detailed_rules.explanation: When postoperative pain is not linked to a specific complication, use G89 postoperative pain codes (Evidence: pg no: 47, L52-L53)

workflow_steps: Step 2: Determine if pain is associated with specific postoperative complication
Step 3: If not associated with complication, assign appropriate G89 code
Step 4: Select specific G89 postoperative pain code

code_ranges.description: Postoperative pain codes for non-complication related pain (Evidence: pg no: 47, L53)
code_ranges.requirement: Pain not associated with specific postoperative complication
usage_rules: Use for postoperative pain without specific complications (Evidence: pg no: 47, L52-L53)

references_to.title: Postoperative pain associated with specific postoperative complication
references_to.explanation: Contrasts with complication-associated postoperative pain coding

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient with significant pain after knee replacement surgery, no complications identified
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient experiencing significant pain following total knee replacement, no postoperative complications noted
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify postoperative pain is documented
Step 2: Verify no specific postoperative complications
Step 3: Assign appropriate G89 postoperative pain code

correct_coding.sequencing: G89 code for non-complication postoperative pain
correct_coding.rationale: Postoperative pain not associated with specific complication uses G89 codes (Evidence: pg no: 47, L52-L53)

incorrect_coding.code: T84.84XA (Pain due to internal orthopedic prosthetic devices)
incorrect_coding.rationale: This would be for complication-related pain, not uncomplicated postoperative pain
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using complication codes when no specific complication exists

warnings: Distinguish between complication-related and non-complication postoperative pain
best_practices: Verify absence of specific postoperative complications before using G89 codes
Use appropriate G89 postoperative pain subcategory
common_mistakes: Using complication codes when no specific complication exists
Not distinguishing between complication and non-complication pain
tips: G89 codes are for postoperative pain without specific complications
Check for documented postoperative complications before code selection
implementation_notes: Contrasts with complication-associated postoperative pain coding
clinical_context: Postoperative pain can occur with or without complications
Coding approach differs based on complication association
